characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: CHARACTERS in a NURGLE Chaos Daemons detachment have the following ability:Each time you make a wound roll of 6+ for a NURGLE DAEMON unit within 6" of any friendly model with the Locus of Virulence, that attack inflicts 1 additional damage.

rules.name: Daemonic Ritual
rules.description:
Instead of moving in their Movement phase, any CHAOS CHARACTER can, at the end of their Movement phase, attempt to summon a DAEMON unit with this ability by performing a Daemonic Ritual (the character cannot do so if they arrived as reinforcements this turn, or if they themselves have been summoned to the battlefield this turn). 

If they do so, first choose one of the four Chaos Gods - KHORNE, TZEENTCH, NURGLE, or SLAANESH. A CHARACTER who owes allegiance to one of the Dark Gods can attempt to summon the units of their patron - for example, a KHORNE CHARACTER could only attempt to summon KHORNE DAEMONS. 

Roll up to 3 dice - this is your summoning roll. You can summon one new unit with the Daemonic Ritual ability to the battlefield that has a Power Rating equal to or less than the total result so long as it has the same Chaos God keyword you chose at the start (in the case of units that have the choice of allegiance, such as Furies, the unit when summoned will have this keyword.) This unit is treated as reinforcements for your army and can be placed anywhere on the battlefield that is entirely within 12" of the character and more than 9" from any enemy model. If the total rolled is insufficient to summon any unit, the ritual fails and no new unit is summoned.

If your summoning roll included any doubles, your character then suffers a mortal wound. If it contained any triples, it instead suffers D3 mortal wounds.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: The Tally of Pestilence starts the battle at 0. Add 1 to the Tally whenever a unit (friend or foe) is destroyed by a NURGLE DAEMON unit, and look up the result on the chart. The results are cumulative.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Each time a model with this ability loses a wound, roll a dice; on a 5+, the model does not lose that wound.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Units with this ability have a 5+ invulnerable save.

characteristics.name: Effect
characteristics.value: No effect

characteristics.name: Effect
characteristics.value: Re-roll hit rolls of 1 for all friendly NURGLE DAEMONS.

characteristics.name: Effect
characteristics.value: Increase the Move characteristics of all friendly NURGLE DAEMONS by 1.

characteristics.name: Effect
characteristics.value: Increase the Strength characteristics of all friendly NURGLE DAEMONS by 1.

characteristics.name: Effect
characteristics.value: Increase the Toughness characteristics of all friendly NURGLE DAEMONS by 1.

characteristics.name: Effect
characteristics.value: Increase the Attacks characteristics of all friendly NURGLE DAEMONS by 1.

characteristics.name: Effect
characteristics.value: Re-roll rolls of 1 for friendly NURGLE DAEMONS Disgustingly Resilient ability.

characteristics.value: Melee

characteristics.name: Type
characteristics.value: Melee

characteristics.name: S
characteristics.value: User

characteristics.name: Abilities
characteristics.value: You can re-roll failed wound rolls for this weapon.

characteristics.name: Range
characteristics.value: Melee

characteristics.name: Type
characteristics.value: Melee

characteristics.name: Abilities
characteristics.value: Each time a model attended by Nurglings fights, it can make D6 additional attacks with this weapon. You can re-roll wound rolls of 1 for these attacks.

Instead of moving in their Movement phase, any CHAOS CHARACTER can, at the end of their Movement phase, attempt to summon a DAEMON unit with this ability by performing a Daemonic Ritual (the character cannot do so if they arrived as reinforcements this turn, or if they themselves have been summoned to the battlefield this turn). 

If they do so, first choose one of the four Chaos Gods - KHORNE, TZEENTCH, NURGLE, or SLAANESH. A CHARACTER who owes allegiance to one of the Dark Gods can attempt to summon the units of their patron - for example, a KHORNE CHARACTER could only attempt to summon KHORNE DAEMONS.

If your summoning roll included any doubles, your character then suffers a mortal wound. If it contained any triples, it instead suffers D3 mortal wounds.

characteristics.name: Powers Known
characteristics.value: Smite and two powers from the Nurgle Discipline

characteristics.name: Characteristic 1
characteristics.value: M

characteristics.name: Characteristic 2
characteristics.value: S

characteristics.name: Characteristic 3
characteristics.value: A

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Roll a D6 at the end of your charge phase if this model made a successful charge diring that phase; on a 4+ you can select one enemy unit within 1" to suffer a mortal wound.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Friendly NURGLE DAEMON units within 6" of this model when they take a Morale test can use this model's Leadership instead of their own.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Units with this ability have a 5+ invulnerable save.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Each time a model with this ability loses a wound, roll a dice; on a 5+, the model does not lose that wound.

characteristics.name: Details
characteristics.value: Smite has a warp charge value of 5. If manifested, the closest visible enemy unit within 18" of the psyker suffers D3 mortal wounds (pg 181). If the result of the Psychic test was more than 10 the target suffers D6 mortal wounds instead.

characteristics.name: Details
characteristics.value: If manifested, select a friendly NURGLE DAEMON unit within 18" of the psyker. One model in that unit regains D3 wounds lost wounds.

characteristics.name: Details
characteristics.value: If manifested, the closest enemy unit within 7" if the psyker and visible to it suffers D3 mortal wounds if it has fewer than 10 models, or D6 mortal wounds if it has 10 models or more.

characteristics.name: Range
characteristics.value: Melee

characteristics.name: Type
characteristics.value: Melee

characteristics.name: Abilities
characteristics.value: Each time a model attended by Nurglings fights, it can make D6 additional attacks with this weapon. You can re-roll wound rolls of 1 for these attacks.

characteristics.name: Type
characteristics.value: Assault 3

characteristics.name: S
characteristics.value: User

characteristics.name: Abilities
characteristics.value: This weapon can be fired within 1" of an enemy unit, and can target enemy units within 1" of friendly units. Excess damage from this weapon is not lost; instead keep allocating damage to another model in the target unit until either all the damage has been allocated or the unit has been destroyed.

characteristics.name: Range
characteristics.value: Melee

characteristics.name: Type
characteristics.value: Melee

characteristics.name: D
characteristics.value: D3

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: If a Great Unclean One with a doomsday bell attempts to summon a unit of NURGLE DAEMONS to the battlefield using a Daemonic Ritual you can roll 4 dice instead of 3 for this summoning roll. In addition, at the start of each of your turns, you may roll a D6 for each NURGLE DAEMON unit within 7" of any friendly Great Unclean Ones with a doomsday bell; on a 4+ a single slain model is returned to that unit.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: When you set up a unit of Nurglings during deployment, they can either be set up in their deployment zone, or anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 9" from the enemy deployment zone and enemy models.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Because of their diminutive size, Nurglings only receive the benefits of their Disgustingly Resilient ability against attacks with a Damage characteristic of 1.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Units with this ability have a 5+ invulnerable save.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Whenever a NURGLE DAEMON unit takes a Morale test within 6" of any friendly Sloppity Bilepipers, roll 2 dice instead of 1 and discard the highest result. In addition, each time a unit fails a Morale test within 6" of any enemy Sloppity Bilepipers, one addtional model is removed from that unit.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of Nurglings and GREAT UNCLEAN ONE units that are within 6" of any friendly Sloppity Bilepipers. In addition, Nurglings and GREAT UNCLEAN ONE units can declare a charge even if they advanced in their Movement phase if they are within 6" of any friendly Sloppity Bilepipers.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Add 2" to the Movement characteristic of all PLAGUEBEARER INFANTRY units within 6" of one or more models with this ability.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Add 1 to all hit rolls made for PLAGUEBEARER units within 6" of one or more friendly models with this ability. In addition, if you make a hit roll of 7+ for a PLAGUEBEARER unit within 6" off one or more friendly models with this ability, you can immediately make one additional attack at the same target with the same weapon (these bonus attacks cannot themselves generate any further attacks).

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: If this unit contains 20 or more models at the start of a phase, your opponent must subtract 1 from all hit rolls for attacks that target them.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Each time a model with this ability loses a wound, roll a dice; on a 5+, the model does not lose that wound.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Units with this ability have a 5+ invulnerable save.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: If you roll a 1 when taking a Morale test for a unit with any Daemonic Icons, reality blinks and the daemonic horde is bolstered. No models flee and D6 slain Plaguebearers are instead added to the unit.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: A unit that includes any Instruments of Chaos adds 1 to their Advance and charge rolls.

This unit is treated as reinforcements for your army and can be placed anywhere on the battlefield that is entirely within 12" of the character and more than 9" from any enemy model. If the total rolled is insufficient to summon any unit, the ritual fails and no new unit is summoned.

If your summoning roll included any doubles, your character then suffers a mortal wound. If it contained any triples, it instead suffers D3 mortal wounds.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Each time a model with this ability loses a wound, roll a dice; on a 5+, the model does not lose that wound.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Units with this ability have a 5+ invulnerable save.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: If you roll a 1 when taking a Morale test for a unit with any Daemonic Icons, reality blinks and the daemonic horde is bolstered. No models flee and 1 slain Plague Drone is instead added to the unit.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: A unit that includes any Instruments of Chaos adds 1 to their Advance and charge rolls.

rules.name: Daemonic Ritual
rules.description:
Instead of moving in their Movement phase, any CHAOS CHARACTER can, at the end of their Movement phase, attempt to summon a DAEMON unit with this ability by performing a Daemonic Ritual (the character cannot do so if they arrived as reinforcements this turn, or if they themselves have been summoned to the battlefield this turn). 

If they do so, first choose one of the four Chaos Gods - KHORNE, TZEENTCH, NURGLE, or SLAANESH. A CHARACTER who owes allegiance to one of the Dark Gods can attempt to summon the units of their patron - for example, a KHORNE CHARACTER could only attempt to summon KHORNE DAEMONS. 

Roll up to 3 dice - this is your summoning roll. You can summon one new unit with the Daemonic Ritual ability to the battlefield that has a Power Rating equal to or less than the total result so long as it has the same Chaos God keyword you chose at the start (in the case of units that have the choice of allegiance, such as Furies, the unit when summoned will have this keyword.) This unit is treated as reinforcements for your army and can be placed anywhere on the battlefield that is entirely within 12" of the character and more than 9" from any enemy model. If the total rolled is insufficient to summon any unit, the ritual fails and no new unit is summoned.

If your summoning roll included any doubles, your character then suffers a mortal wound. If it contained any triples, it instead suffers D3 mortal wounds.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: All enemy VEHICLE units within 1" of a Plague Hulk of Nurgle must subtract 1 from their saving throws.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Each time a model with this ability loses a wound, roll a dice; on a 5+, the model does not lose that wound.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: If this model is reduced to 0 wounds, roll a D6 before removing it from the battlefield and before any embarked models disembark. On a 6 it explodes, and each unit within 6" suffers D3 mortal wounds.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Units with this ability have a 5+ invulnerable save.

characteristics.value: Against INFANTRY targets, failed wound rolls for this weapon are re-rolled.

rules.name: Arch-daemonic Ritual
rules.description:
If your Army contains a unit with the Arch-daemonic Ritual rule, they may instead of being deployed normally be summoned like other Daemons to the battlefield, although with greater risk to the summoner as befits their power and perilous nature. The usual rules for Daemonic Rituals apply with the following alterations:

When attempting an Arch-daemonic Ritual, the summoning player must first declare which unit they are attempting to summon by name beforehand, and only characters with the same Mark of Chaos as the unit you wish to summon can be userd to summon the unit.

When attempting to summon a unit using an Arch-daemonic Ritual, roll up to nine dice - this is your summoning roll. You can summon one new unit with the Arch-daemonic Ritual ability to the battlefield that has a Power Rating equal to or less than the total result so long as it has the same Chaos God keyword as the summoning character. This unit is treated as reinforcements for your army and can be placed anywhere on the battlefield that is within 12" of the summoning character and is more than 9" from any enemy model. If the total rolled is insufficient to summon any unit, the ritual fails and no new unit is summoned. 

If yourArch-daemonic Ritual summoning roll included any doubles, your summoning character then suffers a mortal wound. If it contained any triples, then the summoning character is slain instead (note that the summoning can still be successful, even if the summoning character perishes in the attempt).

characteristics.name: Powers Known
characteristics.value: Smite and two powers from the Nurgle discipline

characteristics.name: Characteristic 1
characteristics.value: M

characteristics.name: Characteristic 2
characteristics.value: S

characteristics.name: Characteristic 3
characteristics.value: A

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: You may use this model's Leadership for friendly Nurgle units within 6" of this model when Morale tests are taken.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Your opponent must subtract 1 from any hit rolls that target friendly NURGLE and DAEMON units within 6" of Scabeiathrax the Bloated in the Fight phase.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: When this model is reduced to 0 wounds, roll a D6 before removing it from the battlefield; on a 4+ it explodes in a tide of filth and each unit within D6" suffers D6 mortal wounds.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Each time a model with this ability loses a wound, roll a dice; on a 5+, the model does not lose that wound.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: This unit has a 4+ invulnerable save.

characteristics.name: Type
characteristics.value: Pistol 2D6

characteristics.name: D
characteristics.value: D3

characteristics.name: Abilities
characteristics.value: This weapon hits automatically.

characteristics.name: Range
characteristics.value: Melee

characteristics.name: Type
characteristics.value: Melee

characteristics.name: Range
characteristics.value: Melee

characteristics.name: Type
characteristics.value: Melee

characteristics.name: Abilities
characteristics.value: After a model accompanied by Nurglings makes its close combat attacks, you can attack with the Nurglings. Make D6 additional attacks, using this weapon profile. You can re-roll wound rolls of 1 for these attacks.

characteristics.name: Details
characteristics.value: Smite has a warp charge value of 5. If manifested, the closest visible enemy unit within 18" of the psyker suffers D3 mortal wounds (pg 181). If the result of the Psychic test was more than 10 the target suffers D6 mortal wounds instead.

characteristics.name: Details
characteristics.value: If manifested, select a friendly NURGLE DAEMON unit within 18" of the psyker. Add 1 to wound rolls made by that unit in the Fight phase. Furthermore, wound rolls of 7+ made for that unit in the Fight phase inflict double damage.

characteristics.name: Details
characteristics.value: If manifested, select a friendly NURGLE DAEMON unit within 18" of the psyker. Until the start of your next Psychic phase, your opponent must select 1 from all hit rolls that target that unit.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Roll a dice each time your Warlord loses a wound in the Fight phase. On a 4+ the unit that inflicted that wound is splashed by acidic ichor and suffers a mortal wound after all of its own attacks have been resolved.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Each Feculent Gnarlmaw in this unit must be set up within 6" of each other, and none can be set up within 1" of any terrain feature.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: After it is set up, a Feculent Gnarlmaw is treated as a terrain feature. It cannot move for any reason, is not treated as a friendly or enemy model, and cannot be targeted or affected by any attacks or abilities.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: All NURGLE DAEMON units - except VEHICLES and MONSTERS - that are completely within 7" of any Feculent Gnarlmaws receive the benefit of cover, but you add 2 to their saving throws instead of 1 (remember invulnerable saves are not benefitted by cover).

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: At the start of your turn, roll a D6 for every unit that is within 3" of any Feculent Gnarlmaws; on a 4+, that unit suffers 1 mortal wound, but on a 6 it suffers D3 mortal wounds instead. NURGLE units are unaffected by this ability.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: NURGLE DAEMON units that are within 7" of any Feculent Gnarlmaws at the start of their turn can shoot and/or charge this turn, even if they Fell Back or Advanced.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: You can re-roll any of the dice used in the summoning roll when a CHAOS CHARACTER from your army that is within 7" of any Feculent Gnarlmaw attempts to summon a unit of NURGLE DAEMONS to the battlefield using a Daemonic Ritual.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: CHARACTERS in a NURGLE Chaos Daemons detachment have the following ability:Each time you make a wound roll of 6+ for a NURGLE DAEMON unit within 6" of any friendly model with the Locus of Virulence, that attack inflicts 1 additional damage.

rules.name: Daemonic Ritual
rules.description:
Instead of moving in their Movement phase, any CHAOS CHARACTER can, at the end of their Movement phase, attempt to summon a DAEMON unit with this ability by performing a Daemonic Ritual (the character cannot do so if they arrived as reinforcements this turn, or if they themselves have been summoned to the battlefield this turn). 

If they do so, first choose one of the four Chaos Gods - KHORNE, TZEENTCH, NURGLE, or SLAANESH. A CHARACTER who owes allegiance to one of the Dark Gods can attempt to summon the units of their patron - for example, a KHORNE CHARACTER could only attempt to summon KHORNE DAEMONS. 

Roll up to 3 dice - this is your summoning roll. You can summon one new unit with the Daemonic Ritual ability to the battlefield that has a Power Rating equal to or less than the total result so long as it has the same Chaos God keyword you chose at the start (in the case of units that have the choice of allegiance, such as Furies, the unit when summoned will have this keyword.) This unit is treated as reinforcements for your army and can be placed anywhere on the battlefield that is entirely within 12" of the character and more than 9" from any enemy model. If the total rolled is insufficient to summon any unit, the ritual fails and no new unit is summoned.

If your summoning roll included any doubles, your character then suffers a mortal wound. If it contained any triples, it instead suffers D3 mortal wounds.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: You can re-roll failed charge rolls for friendly units of Beasts of Nurgle that are within 6" of Horticulous Slimux. In addition, you can add 1 to hit rolls made for friendly units of Beasts of Nurgle that are within 12" of Horticulous Slimux

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Roll a D6 for each enemy unit that Falls Back within 1" of Horticulous Slimux; on a 4+ that unit suffers a mortal wound.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: At the start of your turn, if any models (friend or foe) were slain during the last turn, one NURGLE DAEMON model within 7" of Horticulous Slimux regains 1 lost wound.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: At the end of your Movement phase, you can add a new Feculent Gnarlmaw to your army (containing one Feculent Gnarlmaw). Set it up within 3" of Horticulous Slimux and more than 1" away from any other models and terrain features. Horticulous Slimux cannot use this ability if he performed a Daemonic Ritual this turn.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Units with this ability have a 5+ invulnerable save.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Each time a model with this ability loses a wound, roll a dice; on a 5+, the model does not lose that wound.

characteristics.value: After Horticulous Slimux makes his close combat attacks, you can attack with Mulch. Make 1 additional attack, using this weapon profile.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.value: Beasts of Nurgle sometimes feel left out of the fun, and so bound forth to join in whenever they can. This unit can perform Heroic Interventions as if they were CHARACTERS.
